items.summary: Update the standalone page at frontend/public/valentine.html to be a simple, romantic-themed, single-purpose Valentine prompt that asks “Will you be my Valentine, my love?” with exactly two options: “Yes” and “No”, optimized for iPad Chrome.

Implement the evasive “No” behavior on the standalone page (frontend/public/valentine.html): when the user hovers over or touches the “No” button, it moves to a new random position within its container so it cannot be clicked, while ensuring it does not overlap the “Yes” button.

On “Yes” click, show a celebration/reveal view (in both frontend/public/valentine.html and frontend/src/App.tsx) that displays: (1) the meme-style image with embedded text “You are my forever, Warda.” and (2) the full love letter message content provided by the user, formatted as readable paragraphs in a scrollable layout suitable for iPad Chrome.

Apply a consistent cartoonish romantic visual theme across both the standalone page (frontend/public/valentine.html) and the React flow (frontend/src/App.tsx): warm pink/red palette, playful rounded shapes, heart accents, soft shadows, and a friendly cartoon-like typographic feel, while keeping the UI simple and focused on the single Valentine question and reveal.

Add the meme-style image as a static asset under frontend/public/assets/generated and reference it from both frontend/public/valentine.html and frontend/src/App.tsx using the exact filename valentine-meme-forever-warda.dim_1600x900.png (do not serve images through the backend).
